column3:
I ate too much and now I feel sick.
I shouldn't {{c1::have eaten}} (eat) so much.

I wonder why Tom didn't call me.
He must {{c1::have forgotten}} (forget).

You've signed the contract.
It can't {{c1::be changed}} (change) now.

You went home very early.
You needn't {{c1::have gone}} (go) home so early.

I don't know where the children are.
They might {{c1::be watching}} (watch) TV.

Why are you so late?
You should {{c1::have been}} (be) here an hour ago.

I saw Laura standing outside the cinema.
She must {{c1::have been waiting}} (wait) for somebody.

Why didn't anyone tell me about the problem?
I should {{c1::have been told}} (tell).

Why didn't you contact me while you were away?
You could {{c1::have phoned}} (phone) me.

We had a great day at the beach yesterday.
You ought {{c1::to have come}} (come) with us.
